Course Schedule

The below schedule is from 2023. It will be updated soon for 2024.

Date Topic Assignments/Quizzes/Reflections Readings/Videos
Jan 10 Introduction and the Economics of Conservation

Papers to read: 1) Metrick, A., & Weitzman, M. L. (1998), 2) Adamowicz, W. L. (2016)

Videos to Watch: Nick Huntington-Klien on interpreting regression coefficient, video 1 and video 2
Jan 12 The Economics of Conservation Assignment 1 given (covers Random Assignment, and Regression Analysis) same as Jan 10 class
Jan 17 Counterfactual Thinking Paper to read: Ferraro, P.J. (2009)
Jan 19 Random Assignment, lecture and lab Reflection 1 due midnight Jan 22nd Read: Chapter 1, Angrist and Pischke
Jan 24 The Economics of Forest Conservation Paper to read: Foster, A.D, and Rosenzweig, M.R. (2003)
Jan 26 Regression Analysis, lecture and lab Read: Chapter 2, Angrist and Pischke
Jan 31 The Economics of Forest Conservation Assignment 1 due, Assignment 2 given (Covers DAGs and Instrumental Variables) Paper to read: Foster, A.D, and Rosenzweig, M.R. (2003) (same as Jan 24 class)
Feb 2 Directed Acyclic Graphs Reflection 2 due midnight Feb 5th Read: Chapters 6 and 7 of The Effect, Chapter 3 of Causal Inference: The Mixtape
Feb 7 Economic Development, Species Loss and Extraction Paper to read: Naidoo, R., & Adamowicz, W. L. (2001)
Feb 9 Instrumental Variables Read: Chapter 3, Angrist and Pischke
Feb 14 Economic Development, Species Loss and Extraction Paper to read: Eisenbarth, S. (2022)
Feb 16 Fixed Effects lab Quiz 1 (45 minutes in class, covers Random Assignment, Regression Analysis, DAG’s, and Instrumental Variables), Assignment 2 due, Reflection 3 due midnight Feb 19th Read: The Effect, Chapter 16
Feb 21 Midterm Break
Feb 23 Midterm Break
Feb 28 Ecosystem Services and Land Rental Markets Assignment 3 given (Covers Regression Discontinuity, and Difference-in-Differences) Paper to read: Manning, D.T., and Ando, A. (2022)
Mar 2 Regression Discontinuity, lecture and lab Read: Chapter 4, Angrist and Pischke
Mar 7 Farm Size and Biodiversity Paper to read: Noack, F. et al. (2021)
Mar 9 Differences in Differences, lecture and lab Reflection 4 due midnight March 12th Read: Chapter 5, Angrist and Pischke
Mar 14 Conservation and its impact on labor markets Assignment 3 due, Assignment 4 given (designed to help you start your final projects) Paper to read: Frank, E. (2020)
Mar 16 Topical Discussion Quiz 2 (in-class coding exercise) Paper to be determined (related to topical discussion)
Mar 21 Protected Areas Paper to read: Andam, K.S., Ferraro, P.J., and Sims, K.R.E. (2010)
Mar 23 Data Lab Assignment 4 due, Assignment 5 given (also designed to help you complete tasks related to the final project), Reflection 5 due midnight March 26th We will address issues related to your final projects
Mar 28 Protected Areas Paper to read: Burgess, R., Costa, F. J., & Olken, B. A. (2018)
Mar 30 Data lab Assignment 5 due, Referee report assigned We will address issues related to your final projects
Apr 4 Reintroduction and Local Economies Paper to read: Li, L., & Ando, A. W. (2022)
Apr 6 Endangered Species Act: Matching Methods Reflection 6 due midnight April 9th Paper to read: Ferraro, P. J., McIntosh, C., & Ospina, M. (2007)
Apr 11 Topical Discussion Paper to be determined (related to topical discussion)
Apr 13 Wrap up Quiz 3 (covers Fixed Effects, Regression Discontinuity, Differences and Differences), Referee report due midnight April 21th, Final paper due midnight April 28th
